snippet: Military officials said that the recovery of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl would be a multistep process, beginning with treatment in Germany before further care in the United States.
abstract: Sgt Bowe Bergdahl faces long road to recovery and reintegration following trauma of his five years in captivity as prisoner of Taliban in Afghanistan; officials say Bergdahl is physically weakened and will undergo medical treatment in Germany and longer-term psychological therapy in San Antonio before carefully managed homecoming in Hailey, Idaho.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Bagram Air Base, Afghanistan; Matt Furber from Boise, Idaho; and Emmarie Huetteman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Military officials said that the recovery of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl would be a multistep process, beginning with treatment in Germany before further care in the United States.

headline.main: Mentally, G.I. Has Long Path Back to Idaho
headline.print_headline: Mentally, G.I. Has Long Path Back to Idaho
